Export a dataset to files

exportDatasetToFiles.Rd

Export a dataset to files

Usage

exportDatasetToFiles(path, datasetName = "GiBleed", format = "csv")

Arguments

path

Path to export the files to.

datasetName

Name of the dataset. See availableDatasets() for possibilities.

format

Either 'csv' or 'parquet'.

Value

The list of created files.

Examples

library(OmopDatasets)

datasetsFolder(tempdir())
#> ℹ If you want to create a permanent `OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER` write the following
#>   in your `.Renviron` file:
#> 
#>   OMOP_DATASETS_FOLDER="/tmp/Rtmpa1NvAA"
downloadDataset(datasetName = "GiBleed")
pathToExport <- file.path(tempdir(), "myDatabase")
dir.create(pathToExport)
#> Warning: '/tmp/Rtmpa1NvAA/myDatabase' already exists

exportDatasetToFiles(
  path = pathToExport,
  datasetName = "GiBleed",
  format = "csv"
)
#> ℹ Deleting prior `METADATA` file.
list.files(pathToExport)
#>  [1] "GiBleed.duckdb"            "METADATA"                 
#>  [3] "care_site.csv"             "cdm_source.csv"           
#>  [5] "concept.csv"               "concept_ancestor.csv"     
#>  [7] "concept_class.csv"         "concept_relationship.csv" 
#>  [9] "concept_synonym.csv"       "condition_era.csv"        
#> [11] "condition_occurrence.csv"  "cost.csv"                 
#> [13] "death.csv"                 "device_exposure.csv"      
#> [15] "domain.csv"                "dose_era.csv"             
#> [17] "drug_era.csv"              "drug_exposure.csv"        
#> [19] "drug_strength.csv"         "fact_relationship.csv"    
#> [21] "location.csv"              "measurement.csv"          
#> [23] "metadata.csv"              "note.csv"                 
#> [25] "note_nlp.csv"              "observation.csv"          
#> [27] "observation_period.csv"    "payer_plan_period.csv"    
#> [29] "person.csv"                "procedure_occurrence.csv" 
#> [31] "provider.csv"              "relationship.csv"         
#> [33] "source_to_concept_map.csv" "specimen.csv"             
#> [35] "visit_detail.csv"          "visit_occurrence.csv"     
#> [37] "vocabulary.csv"
